title: (IGNORE) Ensure there's a blank line between each list of changes in the changelog
Bump xmp_toolkit requirement to 1.6
(PATCH) switches af relationship for a reference to the c2pa data to an array of references, one of which is the c2pa spec
body:
## Changes in this pull request
This is a small change that changes the value of the AF relationship key in the PDF's catalog from a reference to an array of references. This change was made because a PDF can have multiple associated files. The previous version assumed the c2pa file spec reference would be the only associated file.

Removes requirement that a resource exists in resources when setting Ingredient Resource ref.
The ingredient c2pa_manifest.format value is now "application/c2pa" instead of "c2pa"

title: Add all of the MIME types that are associated with WAV files

## Overview
This was causing browser integrations to fail based on the detected MIME type for WAV files.

## Changes in this pull request
- Associate `audio/wav`, `audio/x-wav`, `audio/wave` and `audio/vnd.wave` as valid WAV MIME types based on [this comment](https://github.com/jshttp/mime-db/issues/22#issuecomment-107128888).

title: supports removal of manifests from pdf
body:
## Changes in this pull request
This PR adds the ability to remove a manifest from a PDF. It introduces the function `remove_manifest_bytes`, which will attempt to remove an embedded file-based manifest or an annotation-based manifest.

This PR doesn't integrate the new remove manifest API into AssetIO. I have another ticket to add write support to AssetIO coming up.

title: (MINOR) Signer can call timestamp authority directly
body: Adds a new trait function to `Signer` and `AsyncSigner` which allows the trait implementation to call the RFC 3161 timestamp service directly. Default implementation is provided which behaves as before, so this is not (should not be) a breaking change.

title: implements pdf read support
body:
## Changes in this pull request
This feature adds pdf read support to c2pa-rs. The support is limited, however. Only PDFs with a single manifest (no incremental update manifests) are currently supported. More complete support for PDF is coming shortly.

This PR also introduces a new test dependency named `mockall`. This allows unit testing the new pdf_io module without having to read entire PDF files into memory. Let me know what you think! We've been using this on the services and really enjoying how it makes unit testing easier.

title: (MINOR) Minor improvements for Wasm and Node.js interoperability
body:
## Changes in this pull request
This PR contains the following relatively minor changes:
- **Removes the `add_thumbnails` flag** - I feel pretty strongly that this should be completely opt-in, since many place we will be integrating this library will have built-in or more efficient graphics libraries available. Additionally, just including this feature increases the size of any dylibs we build from this due to the inclusion of the `image` crate.
- **Removes `Send` from the `CAIRead` trait when building for Wasm** - We aren't supporting WebAssembly Threads yet, and this is causing more complexity than we currently need in this environment. We are leaving it in for anything that gets compiled to C since we do want it when passing asset data across tokio-managed threads.
- **Expose `CAIRead` and `CAIWrite` traits** - It seemed like these traits weren't exposed publicly (the `asset_io` module is `pub(crate)`, so I had to expose these to be able to implement them in JavaScript/Wasm.

## Checklist
- [ ] This PR represents a single feature, fix, or change.
- [ ] All applicable changes have been documented.
- [ ] Any `TO DO` items (or similar) have been entered as GitHub issues and the link to that issue has been included in a comment.

title: Add `Send` to `CAIRead` trait so that it can be used across threads
body:
## Changes in this pull request
I need to pass asset data across threads when working in the Node.js SDK due to how we need to offload computation off of the main thread. Since we operate off the `CAIRead` trait, we need to explicitly add the `Send` trait to allow this functionality.

title: Fix for #195 make_test_images missing ingredient references
body:
Removed logic in Manifest to deduplicate ingredients with identical hashes
it was not comparing the ingredient fields for differences in things like instanceId
Applications are now responsible for deduplicating ingredients
Updated make_test_images to deduplicate identical ingredients
and have actions reference the same instance id when needed

title: Support for writing and reading manifest data from simple PDFs (without incremental updates or signatures)
body:
## Changes in this pull request
This PR introduces the `pdf_utils::Pdf` struct and the `pdf_utils::C2paPdf` trait, public (to the crate), `lopdf` abstractions with functionality to read and write manifest data from PDFs. This code works against `wasm` and `non-wasm` targets.

I intend to add read support next, then round out the work with incremental update support. I opened this PR against `origin/pdf` instead of `main` as I want to get this in front of folks before getting to far and this work doesn't support reading manifests or incremental PDF updates. 

## Checklist
- [x] This PR represents a single feature, fix, or change.
- [x] All applicable changes have been documented.
- [x] Any `TO DO` items (or similar) have been entered as GitHub issues and the link to that issue has been included in a comment.
